:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!

I have been noticing issues with Cloudflare CDN not updating cached versions of pages recently... Probably 4-5 occasions on different pages (not just a blog listing, but I have seen it happen in this scenario as well), I have updated within the page editor, clicked update, and experienced same as you <@U044VLH18R2>: live page different from preview, and live URL with ?nocache added as URL parameter displays correctly.

Because HubSpot serves up a non-cached URL correctly, and live URL incorrectly, it's making me think there is some issue lately with HubSpot's connection to Cloudflare CDN.

After waiting 6-12hr, the live page magically updates, with no other action on my side within HubSpot. :thinking_face: :face_with_raised_eyebrow:

I also found the workaround of spinning up a new page with same template work to display changes. But then I got tired of doing that to resolve the display issues, as it resulted in so many extra steps when managing a lot of edits
